com.siperian.sif.message.mrm

Class PromotePendingXrefsRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianRequest
      • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianObjectRequest
        • com.siperian.sif.message.mrm.PromotePendingXrefsRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SiperianObjectUidProvider, Serializable

    public class PromotePendingXrefsRequest
extends SiperianObjectRequest

    Promotes or flags for promotion the XREF records specified in the request. Promote means to change the state of a record from PENDING to ACTIVE. When the flagForPromote option is set, then this API will queue the specified xref records for promotion via the next run of the PROMOTE batch process. Otherwise, the API will immediately promote the specified xref records from PENDING to ACTIVE. The following describes the behavior of this API based on various xref states:

    • ACTIVE and DELETED records will return an error.
    • PENDING records will be made ACTIVE.
    Required Parameters:
    • SiperianObjectUid - the base object or package that contains the record to promote. If this object is a base object, it must be state management enabled. If this object is a package, it must be based on a base object that has state management enabled and must be put-enabled.
    • XrefKeys - represent the records to promote in the base object or package specified using setSiperianObjectUid(). Each XrefKey entry selects one XREF record to promote.

    Optional Parameters:

    • ColumnNames - When a list of column names is provided in the request, only the columns represented by the list of names will be kept on the XREF promoted to the ACTIVE state. Data for columns that are not specified will be lost after the promotion. This parameter is only available for online promotion and is ignored when the setFlagForPromote() option is set to true. Example: A PENDING record has the following fields=values (a=1, b=2, c=3). If the list of column names specified includes "a" and "b", then after the promote request is executed, the resulting record will be in the ACTIVE state and have the following fields=values (a=1, b=2). In this example, the value c=3 is discarded after promotion.
    • FlagForPromote - When this option is set to True, then the records specified in the request will not be promoted immediately. Instead, the records will be flagged for promotion. The records will then be promoted only the next time the Promote batch process is executed in the Hub.
    Usage Examples: The following example immediately promotes the "FIRST_NAME" and "LAST_NAME" fields for the XREF record with sourceKey=1234 and system=CRM in the package CUSTOMER_UPDATE. If the XREF record is ACTIVE or DELETED, an error will be returned. If the XREF record is PENDING, it will be made ACTIVE.
    PromotePendingXrefsRequest request = new PromotePendingXrefsRequest();
    ArrayList columnNames = new ArrayList();
    columnNames.add("FIRST_NAME");
    columnNames.add("LAST_NAME");
    request.setColumnNames(columnNames); // Optional
    XrefKey xrefKey = new XrefKey();
    xrefKey.setSourceKey("1234");
    xrefKey.setSystemName("CRM");
    ArrayList xrefKeys = new ArrayList();
    xrefKeys.add(xrefKey);
    request.setXrefKeys(xrefKeys); // Required
    request.setSiperianObjectUid("PACKAGE.CUSTOMER_UPDATE"); //Required

    PromotePendingXrefsResponse response = (PromotePendingXrefsResponse) sipClient.process(request);

    The following example flags the XREF record with sourceKey=1234 and system=CRM in the package CUSTOMER_UPDATE for promotion the next time the Promote batch process is run.

    PromtoePendingXrefsRequest request = new PromotePendingXrefsRequest();
    XrefKey xrefKey = new XrefKey();
    xrefKey.setSourceKey("1234");
    xrefKey.setSystemName("CRM");
    ArrayList xrefKeys = new ArrayList();
    xrefKeys.add(xrefKey);
    request.setFlagForPromote(true); // Optional
    request.setXrefKeys(xrefKeys); // Required
    request.setSiperianObjectUid("PACKAGE.CUSTOMER_UPDATE"); //Required

    PromotePendingXrefsResponse response = (PromotePendingXrefsResponse) sipClient.process(request);

    See Also:
    PromotePendingXrefsResponse, XrefKey, XrefResult, Serialized Form

    API Pair: PromotePendingXrefsResponse

    API Group: State Management

      • getColumnNames

        public List getColumnNames()
        See corresponding setter method for details.
        Returns:
        The list of columns to promote to ACTIVE. Only available for online (not batch) promotion.

      • setColumnNames

        public void setColumnNames(List columnNames)
        This parameter is used to specify a list of columns to promote with this request. This will only be used when setFlagForPromote(boolean) is set to false (online promotion).
        Parameters:
        columnNames - The list of columns (String) to promote to ACTIVE. Only available for online (not batch) promotion.

      • isFlagForPromote

        public boolean isFlagForPromote()
        See corresponding setter method for details.
        Returns:
        True = Flag xref records for batch promotion. False = Promote records immediately.

      • setFlagForPromote

        public void setFlagForPromote(boolean flagForPromote)
        This parameter is used to specify that a record should be promoted the next time the Promote batch process is executed instead of immediately.
        Parameters:
        flagForPromote - True = Flag xref records for batch promotion. False = Promote records immediately.

      • getRecordKey

        public RecordKey getRecordKey()
        See corresponding setter method for details
        Returns:
        The RecordKey object representing the BO record that is to have it's XREFs with the specified interactionId promoted.

      • setRecordKey

        public void setRecordKey(RecordKey recordKey)
        This is an optional parameter. When specified, Interaction ID must also be specified. When this paramtere is not null, promote only the XREF children of the specified BO record with the interaction id from the request.
        Parameters:
        recordKey - The RecordKey object representing the BO record that is to have it's XREFs with the specified interactionId promoted.
